Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

Malice:
 
Malice tried to get the dust out of his optics as Night Strike charged him.  He could see out of his right optic, and saw Night Strike almost on top of him.  He took a step back, clotheslined the minion, and jumped up to stomp in Night Strike's mid section.  After he landed and Night Strike sprawled out, he grabbed both of the minion's arms, pulled tight, and started stomping on Night Strike's chest.  He also took the liberty of draining a little energy, his reserve was low and he wanted to finish Night Strike off in a most painful way.

airly2000 <airly2002@...> wrote:
Nightstrike:

Night strike quickly took dust and trow towards Malice's eyes when 
he was close, after that he rolled away and stood up and ran toward 
Malice willingkill him right there


--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> 
wrote:
> Malice:
>  
> Malice dropped both his swords and charged head on toward the 
oncoming strike.  The minion's sword pierced the bounty hunter's 
side, but Malice knocked Nightstrike's hand off the sword to get him 
in a headlock, pulled tight, then swung the minion into the many 
rocks and trees in the area.  After a while of thrashing 
Nightstrike, Malice dropped him, pulled out the sword from his side, 
healed the wound, and raced back to get his swords.  He reclaimed 
them and went back to finish Nightstrike off.
> 
> airly2000 <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> NightStrike::
> 
> Night strike dodged the shots and tried to strike Malice again 
with his sword
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> 
wrote:
> Malice:
>   
> Malice charged forward, parried the minion's strike and sliced his 
side with the katanna, then smacked him in the back with the flat 
side of Verte- Breaker.  He slowed and stopped, pulled his disruptor 
rifle, and fired a few shots into the back of the minion Night 
Strike.  He spotted an energon deposit, stuck the katanna tip into 
it, and in full view of the public, began absorbing the energy from 
the deposit.
> 
>
